alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 11:16PM AKST until January 31 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Total snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibility as low as one half mile. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta Coast. * WHEN...Until 5 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel may be difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility with near whiteout conditions at times. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Localized blizzard conditions are possible from Kipnuk north to Newtok and Mekoryuk through early Wednesday morning. Visibilities may also briefly fall to as low as one half mile as far east as Bethel due to bands of moderate to heavy snow overnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
